text: - Hi, I'm Phil.
I'm a product manager for AWS Elemental.
My team works on video services
for broadcasters predominantly.

The video industry has
been roughly the same,
you know, for the last 50 years.
In the last, I would say 10 years,
there's been a seismic shift
to predominantly online streaming
and being able to create services,

tools, products, things
that customers can use

to further their business
in this new digital world,
is really fulfilling.

My personal journey in sort
of the video streaming world
started about 10 years ago

when I transitioned from
being behind the camera
to being in the technology world of media.

There's a lot of fundamental
technology on the web
that underpins video delivery
and I wanted to get a part of that,
but it's always day one.

So there isn't ever a
time that's too late.
You haven't ever missed the boat.

If you come in and you
decide that you want to learn
and develop a certain path,

the amount of opportunity
within AWS to move,

you know, laterally or vertically
and go different areas,
is practically unlimited.

It's really up to you how you
wanna develop your career.
We see people come into our team.
We see people go out of our team
and that is sort of encouraged.
We don't mind it when somebody leaves
because they've gone to an area
that they're more passionate about,

because there's someone equally
coming in on the other end.

You're free to explore, you
know, to your heart's content.
(upbeat music)
